title: DSF6010 Application of Data Engineering | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module trains you in data wrangling using Python, creating and working with SQL and NoSQL databases, big data processing with Apache Spark, and machine learning with sklearn, preparing them for an entry-level position in data engineering.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses

This module trains you in data wrangling using Python, creating and working with SQL and NoSQL databases, big data processing with Apache Spark, and machine learning with sklearn, preparing them for an entry-level position in data engineering.
AI and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics
Effective from AY2024/25 Trimester 2 (January 2025), the Postgraduate Certificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory will be retired. For more details, please refer to the full notice
This module aims to equip the you with skills ranging from data wrangling, big data processing to machine learning.
Upon completion of the course, you will be equipped with the necessary skills to excel in an entry-level position in data engineering.

You will have the ability to confidently carry out exploratory data analysis using Python, design and create both SQL and NoSQL databases, create ETL (Extract Transform Load) data pipelines in Apache Spark, create supervised machine learning models in sklearn, and perform unsupervised techniques such as clustering.
With this comprehensive set of skills, you will be prepared to take on the challenges of the data engineering industry.
Professionals who have experience in programming and are interested to find out more about data engineering

"The course has equipped me with the necessary techniques for data structures and how to handle them. The instructors were friendly and patient, and they reached out to help all students that were struggling. I wish nothing but success for the course."
Participants will be able to apply data wrangling techniques, using libraries such as Numpy and Pandas to transform data from one form to another

Participants will be taught basic SQL and they will be able to write and debug simple SQL queries on a database for CRUD (Create Retrieve Update Delete) operations. Participants will also be taught principles of database design (normal forms)
Participants will be taught the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases and be able to contrast the situations where each should be used
Participants will similarly have to be able to carry out CRUD operations on a NoSQL database such as MongoDB
Participants will be taught how to create a simple data pipeline consisting of data ingestion, data preparation and generating views / queries
Participants will be able to use tools such as sklearn to create machine learning models using a range of techniques such as decision trees or neural networks
Participants will be exposed to unsupervised learning techniques such as k-means and hierarchical clustering
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Prior to joining SIT, Dr Soh Cheng Lock started a firm in Artificial Intelligence, creating their own A.I. Product in sports analytics. He also consulted at a drone company and was instrumental in both creating and launching their A.I. Platform to carry out image classification/recognition of drone images.

Another one of the highlights of his career included the development and launch of a nation-wide LPG ordering system, empowered with data analytics for ExxonMobil.
Dr Soh also served at I2R, A-Star for three years as part of his PhD bond. There he was the Principle Investigator of several key industrial projects within the Data Mining Department, including projects with a financial MNC, (on Fraud Detection) and a local SME(Customer Analytics).
Dr. Soh graduated with a PhD in Computer Science from Imperial College London, Masters from Singapore MIT Alliance and holds a Bachelors (First Class Honours) in Computer Engineering from NUS.
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Vivek Balachandran is currently an Asst. Professor with Singapore Institute of Technology and the Deputy CEO of Verbosecurity Pte. Ltd. He has been in the field of cybersecurity for over 9 years and in the field of computer science for over 15 years. He completed his Ph.D in Computer Science from Nanyang Technological University Singapore and Masters (with gold medal) in Computer Science from National Institute of Technology, India. He has worked as a Research Scientist at I2R, A-Star for 2 years. During his tenure there he worked on incorporating A.I based solutions to improve mobile phone security. As an academic he teaches cyber security and computer science courses to students and is involved in various research projects related to AI enabled cyber-crime detection, Security Analytics, Software Security, Compiler Optimization, Quantum computing etc.
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Wei ZHANG received the B.Sc. degree in electronic information science and technology from the School of Science, Xidian University, Xi’an, China, in 2008, the M.Eng. degree in circuits and system from the School of Electronic Engineering, Xidian University in 2011, and the Ph.D. degree in computer science from the School of Computer Science and Engineering, Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore, in 2015. He is currently an Assistant Professor with the Information and Communications Technology Cluster, Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). Before joining SIT, he was a Scientist at the Agency for Science, Technology, and Research (A*STAR), Singapore. From 2015 to 2017, he was a Research Fellow at NTU, Singapore. His current research interests include energy optimization for the information and communication technology area, as well as smart buildings and smart cities.
Introduction to data programming and Python
Assembling data and handling missing data
SQL basics – data definition language, data manipulation language
Relational database and SQL for relational data
Advanced topics on database and discussion
Introduction to NoSQL, REST, and MongoDB CRUD
Building MongoDB for a Python Application
Introduction to Big Data, Hadoop, Apache Spark, RDD, Functional Programming, and Data Pipelines
Introduction to supervised machine learning algorithms and clustering through K Nearest Neighbour algorithm
Theory behind Decision Trees in Supervised Learning
Introduction to Functional Programming and machine learning programming
Implementing clustering with K Nearest Neighbour, Decision Trees, and Random Forest
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit-bearing assessment during the module
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$5,886.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

The Postgraduate Cetificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory is designed to equip engineers for greater business competitiveness amidst the exponential growth in robotic automation, information and communication technologies.
Learning for Life Series - Seaw Ker Boon

He may have already traded in his student card for a staff pass, but SIT alumni and staff member Seaw Ker Boon chose to head back to the classroom to become a student once again. The aspiring software architect shares why he attended the Machine Learning courses under the SITLEARN programme.
Be introduced to creative AI, covering generative models, their applications, ethics, and hands-on experience.
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
This course demystifies machine learning concepts and helps you gain technical grounding and foresight for digital transformation in business.
AI and Machine Learning, Computer Ethics and Privacy
Supported by CPA Australia, this course teaches you how to plan, design, and apply data analytics tests to identify red flags of fraud.
Accounting and Finance, Business Management, Data Science and Analytics, Audit
Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in data analytics. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering.
BEng (Hons) Electrical & Electronic Engineering or Infrastructure & Systems Engineering
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Competency-based Education
DSF6030 Managing and Leading Artificial Intelligence Projects for Smart Factory
Gain business deployment skills for successful AI projects, validate project viability, and deliver strategic benefits through rapid prototyping and risk management.
Postgraduate Certificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory
Advanced Manufacturing, AI and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics, Internet of Things

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
